definition[0]: a British television DIY show broadcast from 1996 until 2004. Each show involved two couples who would redesign a room in each otherâ€™s houses with the help of a designer and a carpenter. At the end of the show, each couple would be shown the room which the other couple had changed. Presenters and designers on the show included Carole Smillie, Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, Linda Barker, Anna Ryder Richardson and Graham Wynne. Many of designers liked to use MDF in their designs.
